title: Suns fire Budenholzer, say change was 'needed'
content: The Suns have fired coach Mike Budenholzer after missing the NBA playoffs and play-in tournament with the largest payroll in league history.

title: Pelicans fire Griffin, eye Dumars as top executive
content: The Pelicans have fired executive vice president David Griffin after six years as the team's head of basketball operations. The Pelicans had a 209-263 record and twice made the playoffs during his tenure.

title: Lynx get Mystics' Samuelson for '26 1st-rounder
content: Karlie Samuelson, a career 39.7% shooter from 3-point range, has been traded from the Mystics to the Lynx in exchange for a first-round pick in the 2026 WNBA draft.

title: No. 77 is No. 1: Doncic jersey is NBA's top-selling
content: Luka Doncic's No. 77 Lakers jersey was the NBA's most popular jersey for the 2024-25 regular season based on NBAStore.com sales.

title: Officials: Ex-LSU WR Lacy died in apparent suicide
content: Former LSU receiver Kyren Lacy, who was found dead Saturday night in Houston, died in an apparent suicide in his car while being pursued by authorities, according to a Harris County sheriff's report released Sunday.

title: Captain America: Judge to lead U.S. at '26 WBC
content: Yankees slugger Aaron Judge, the reigning AL MVP, has been named the captain of Team USA when he makes his World Baseball Classic debut in 2026.

title: Peterson, 8-time Pro Bowler, retires as Cardinal
content: Cornerback Patrick Peterson retired from the NFL on Monday as a member of the Cardinals, the team that selected him fifth overall in the 2011 draft.

title: Projecting all three rounds of the WNBA draft
content: The Dallas Wings are on the clock. From Paige Bueckers to pick No. 38, our mock draft projects every pick.

title: Seattle's pick at No. 2? Five questions heading into the draft
content: Who might challenge Paige Bueckers for Rookie of the Year? Which team is positioned to win the WNBA draft?

title: Who are the most fun teams to watch this season? Let's rank all 30
content: Star power, mammoth home runs and ... cotton candy fries? Here are baseball's most exciting squads for 2025.

title: 'It's the best day of my golfing life': Rory McIlroy finally gets his green jacket
content: There were plenty of nerves involved, but in the end, McIlroy finally won the Masters, got to put on the winner's jacket and completed the career Grand slam.

title: From 'Ted Lasso' appearances to honest talks about being fired: Inside Pete Carroll's USC class
content: This spring, in addition to being named head coach of the Las Vegas Raiders, Carroll has been moonlighting as a college professor.

title: Why Sedona Prince is the toughest WNBA draft prospect to evaluate
content: She's a skilled 6-7 center, but some GMs have expressed doubt about drafting Sedona Prince after accusations of intimate partner violence.

title: NBA coaching carousel: What's next for the Suns, Nuggets, Grizzlies and Kings jobs?
content: Which NBA coaching jobs are available? Which situations are the most appealing? Tim Bontemps breaks down the vacancies.

title: 30 years after Ki-Jana Carter went No. 1, Ashton Jeanty can help RBs regain draft prominence
content: Running backs are cool again in the NFL, and they're the strongest position group in this class. But will a running back get picked first ever again?

title: How high would Ohio State's Jeremiah Smith go in this draft? We asked NFL insiders
content: Smith won't be eligible for the draft until 2027, but the league is already excited about his talent.

title: Concacaf prez blasts 64-team World Cup plan
content: Concacaf president Victor Montagliani has joined other confederations in opposing the proposal of CONMEBOL leader Alejandro Domínguez to expand the World Cup to 64 teams for the 2030 edition of the international tournament.

title: Szczesny: Will accept No. 2 role if Flick wishes
content: Barcelona goalkeeper Wojciech Szczesny said on Monday he will accept being dropped for Marc-André ter Stegen if that is what coach Hansi Flick decides.

title: Heartbreak for Brady as Birmingham lose in final
content: Birmingham City were dealt a shock 2-0 defeat by Peterborough United in the Vertu Trophy final at Wembley Stadium on Sunday, with NFL legend and minority owner of the club Tom Brady watching on.

title: 'They're bluffers!' - Keane slams Utd after loss
content: Roy Keane accused Manchester United players of being "bluffers" after their latest harrowing Premier League defeat on Sunday.

title: Van Dijk expects 'a big summer' at Liverpool
content: Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk has hinted it will be a "big summer" for the club as they look to build on a successful debut season under Arne Slot.

title: Newcastle boss Howe recovering from pneumonia
content: Newcastle United manager Eddie Howe has thanked fans for their well wishes after the club announced on Monday that he is suffering from pneumonia.

title: McIlroy hopes to 'inspire' Utd after Masters win
content: New Masters champion Rory McIlroy has said he would be happy to don his Green Jacket at a Manchester United game if it could "inspire some better play" from his boyhood club.

title: Messi 'changing how world sees MLS' with Miami
content: Inter Miami coach Javier Mascherano credited Lionel Messi for impacting the growth of Major League Soccer since signing with the club in 2023, but quickly added that more progress can be made.

title: Real Madrid, Mbappe's malaise, Man United adrift, Bayern's Der Klassiker lessons, more
content: Mbappe's red card punctuated another bad Madrid outing -- not good ahead of the second leg with Arsenal. Elsewhere, Bayern learned a lot from Der Klassiker and Man United look completely lost, as Gab Marcotti recaps the weekend.

title: Who will new featherweight title-holder Volkanovski fight in his first defense?
content: Should Alexander Volkanovski get Movsar Evloev? Is Paddy Pimblett-Charles Oliveira a real possibility? Let's talk about matchups after UFC 314.

title: MLS Power Rankings: New No. 1 Vancouver proves it's for real
content: While Miami sputtered vs. Chicago, Vancouver jumped to No. 1 in our MLS Power Rankings by demolishing Austin.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Juventus to rescue Højlund from Man United?
content: Could Rasmus Højlund leave Man United and return to Italy? Transfer Talk has the latest news and gossip.

title: Did Lewis Hamilton have a breakthrough with Ferrari in Bahrain?
content: Lewis Hamilton has struggled to adapt to his new home at Ferrari, but he might have turned a corner in Bahrain.

title: 'GPS spoofing': every mission was achieved as planned, says IAF
content: Global Positioning System spoofing is considered to be a form of cyberattack that includes generating false GPS signals to mislead an aircraft

title: Jon Lee Anderson’s biography of Che Guevara released in Tamil
content: The two-volume translation captures the evolution of the greatest revolutionary and Marxist of the 20th Century and introduces him as a man with vulnerable moments, fears, and shortcomings

title: DMK government will always strive to ensure a bright future for Adi Dravidars and Tribal communities: Stalin
content: Speaking at an event held to commemorate Ambedkar’s birth anniversary, he says democracy has taken root across all domains through the transformation achieved by the Dravidian movement

title: Blast in firecracker unit: police, firemen, and local residents play pivotal role in rescue operation
content: Swift action in securing the large stock of firecrackers and raw materials stored on the premises prevented the fire from spreading further

title: Tamil Nadu Police issue notice to the IndiaMart portal for facilitating illegal sale of scheduled drugs
content: The police took the action following the arrest of at least 10 youth who had procured scheduled drugs illegally through the portal and seizure of more than 10,000 tablets at Sriperumbudur and Oragadam in Kancheepuram district recently

title: On Ambedkar Jayanti, Tejashwi visits house of Dalit man, terms BJP a ‘feudal party’
content: He also alleged that the BJP was continuously trying to weaken the ideology and Constitution of Baba Saheb

title: Residents living in transit camp for 40 years demand CID probe
content: After their lands in Navi Mumbai were acquired for a port township project over 40 years ago, the residents have been living in a transit camp; their fight for rehabilitation has been continuing and they have now sought a CID probe into the reasons for the delay in their rehabilitation

title: Indian agencies approached Belgium for Mehul Choksi’s extradition in October 2024
content: The Enforcement Directorate has so far attached and seized assets worth ₹2,566 crore in connection with the investigation against the Punjab National Bank scam case “mastermind”

title: EU Trade Chief Seeks Joint Effort With US On Fair Tariff Deal
content: The European Union is seeking a fair deal on tariffs with the United States, European Trade Commissioner Maros Sefcovic said on Monday, adding that this would require a "significant joint effort" on both sides.

title: Meta Chief Mark Zuckerberg Testifies At Landmark US Antitrust Trial
content: Meta chief and co-founder Mark Zuckerberg took the stand Monday in a landmark US anti-trust trial in which his social media juggernaut stands accused of abusing its market power to acquire Instagram and WhatsApp before they could become competitors.

title: Sufficient Checks And Balances In Election Commission's Process: Calcutta High Court
content: The Calcutta High Court has held that there are sufficient checks and balances in the process adopted by the Election Commission of India while scrutinising the nomination of a parliamentary or assembly polls candidate.

title: China, Vietnam Sign Agreements After Xi Jinping's Warning On Protectionism
content: China and Vietnam signed dozens of cooperation agreements Monday, strengthening ties between the communist-run countries after Chinese leader Xi Jinping warned that protectionism "leads nowhere" and that a trade war would have "no winners".

title: Ambedkar Museum, Tallest Statue To Be Set Up In Bengaluru: Siddaramaiah
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Monday announced that a museum on Ambedkar will come up in Bengaluru on the lines of the one in neighbouring Andhra Pradesh, along with the country's tallest statue of the architect of the constitution.

title: Jain Monks Attacked After They Refused To Give Money To Drunk Men In Madhya Pradesh
content: Inebriated persons armed with sticks and sharp weapons allegedly attacked three Jain monks, who were resting in a temple, after being refused money in Madhya Pradesh's Neemuch district, leaving them injured, a police official said on Monday.

title: 'West Philippine Sea', Once Invisible To Most Users, Now Seen On Google Maps
content: A Google Maps scan on Monday of the body of water directly west of the Philippines now shows a name once invisible to most users -- the West Philippine Sea.

title: UP Cop Mistakenly Names Judge As "Accused" In Theft Case, Suspended
content: In Uttar Pradesh's Firozabad, a judge ordered a cop to issue a non-bailable warrant against a man who was accused of theft. The police officer, instead of listing the accused, 'mistakenly' named the judge in the warrant.

title: Odisha Man Kills Father In Revenge For Mother's Murder That He Witnessed: Cops
content: A 22-year-old man allegedly hacked his father to death in Odisha's Sundergarh district on Monday to take revenge for his mother's murder, police said.

title: 2 Girls Were Locked Inside Car In Telangana. Found Dead 2 Hours Later
content: Two girls, aged four and five, died of "suffocation" after accidentally getting locked inside a car in Telangana's Ranga Reddy district on Monday, the police said.

title: NDTV Exclusive: EU Space Envoy Urges Rules-Based Order Amid China's Posturing
content: Space is for everyone to explore and technology for everyone's benefit, emphasized European Union's special envoy for Space Marjolijn van Deelen, who is in New Delhi to enhance cooperation in space between India and Europe.

title: Hungary Passes Constitutional Amendments Targeting LGBTQ People, Dual Nationals
content: Hungarian lawmakers on Monday overwhelmingly backed constitutional changes targeting the country's LGBTQ community and dual nationals, the latest step to strengthen longtime nationalist Prime Minister Viktor Orban.

title: "Confident Supreme Court Won't...": Union Minister On Challenge To Waqf Act
content: Minority Affairs minister Kiren Rijiju, refering to the legal challenge to the amended Waqf law, told NDTV today that he is "confident" that the Supreme Court would not "venture into legislative matter".

title: Man Allegedly Kills Live-In Partner In Gurugram, Arrested
content: A crime branch team of the Gurugram Police has arrested a man for allegedly killing his live-in partner on March 11, police said on Monday.

title: Video: Congress MLA Grabs BJP Leader By Collar, Slaps Him In Rajasthan
content: Congress MLA Indira Meena had an altercation with a local BJP leader in Sawaimadhopur district over the installation of a commemorative plaque at the site of a statue of Dr B R Ambedkar.

title: '1,25,000 Truckloads' Of Debris To Be Removed In Quake-Hit Myanmar: UN
content: The devastating earthquake that hit Myanmar last month has displaced tens of thousands and left the conflict-hit country in urgent need of large-scale debris removal, the United Nations said Monday.

title: Union Minister Pashupati Paras Breaks Ties With NDA, To Contest Bihar Polls Alone
content: In a significant political development ahead of the 2025 Bihar Assembly elections, Rashtriya Lok Janshakti Party (RLJP) chief and former Union Minister Pashupati Kumar Paras announced his party's exit from the National Democratic Alliance (NDA).

title: Forensic samples received by government labs can be analysed by private labs too: Home Minister
content: Every year, around 36,000 students will graduate from National Forensic Sciences University (NFSU), many of whom will go on to work in private forensic laboratories too, says Amit Shah

title: PNB loan fraud case: Mehul Choksi was arrested from hospital, had filed ‘freedom request’ on health grounds
content: Fugitive businessman’s lawyer in India says the plea in Belgium says probe can continue without the need for Mr. Choksi’s custody; says his client is suffering from cancer and was kidnapped and tortured in 2021

title: CDSCO upgrades its online registration system for medical devices
content: The move is aimed at improving ease of doing business and streamlining the regulatory process for manufacturers

title: Major banks cut lending, deposit rates following RBI’s repo rate cut
content: India’s largest lender State Bank of India and the largest private sector bank HDFC Bank cut their deposit interest rates by 25 basis points

title: Senior Babus transferred, waiting IAS officials get postings in Andhra Pradesh
content: Senior IAS officer Ram Prakash Sisodia transferred to Handloom and Textiles, sparking debate among bureaucrats in Secretariat

title: Union Social Justice Minister calls Ambedkar a staunch nationalist
content: Union Minister Virendra Kumar spoke of how Ambedkar refused offers from Christian missionaries and Muslim leaders, and embraced Buddhism instead, when he began his search for a new religion

title: ‘Wealthy Indians are under reporting their income to avoid taxes’
content: A paper by Delhi School of Economics director Ram Singh points to anomalies and assesses how their income fares against their wealth

title: WB violence: With broken homes, vandalised shops people face uncertain future
content: Hundreds of people take shelter in camps in adjoining Malda district, in Murshidabad violence signs of violence evident on streets

title: Bhu Bharati portal to provide permanent solution to land issues: CM Revanth Reddy
content: The Congress government introduced the new Record of Rights (ROR) Act to ensure land rights for every genuine individual in the State, the Chief Minister said

title: Pashupati Paras’s RLJP quits NDA
content: “I along with my party’s five MPs have quit NDA today. I’ve been with the NDA since 2014 and even won six seats in 2019 Lok Sabha poll but later the NDA did injustice with us…you media persons know it all”, Mr. Paras told The Hindu

title: Trump administration’s drastic changes a cause for concern for Indian students in U.S.
content: Education counsellors and foreign education consultants however say that while it is unlikely for students who are already pursuing courses to be affected, many new PhD applications are being rejected.

title: Rally held to condemn Waqf Act on Ambedkar’s birth anniversary
content: Bike and car rally in Adilabad protests Waqf Act and celebrates Ambedkar’s birth anniversary, led by MLC Amir Ali Khan

title: Belgium authorities confirm India’s extradition request after Mehul Choksi’s arrest
content: Choksi is wanted, along with his nephew Nirav Modi, in a case by PNB alleging loan frauds worth more than ₹13,578 crore; Union Law Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal said the arrest was a victory of the government’s diplomacy

title: Congress, AAP spar in Punjab as police book Opposition leader Bajwa
content: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann hits back at the Congress, asks leaders of Opposition parties to refrain from engaging in “politics of threat and terror”.

title: Video: Water Tanker Rolls Over While Trying To Overtake Truck In Bengaluru
content: A water tanker was tailing a truck on an open road in Bengaluru. The driver steered left to overtake the truck from the edge of the road, but he lost control of the vehicle.

title: French Public Hospital Staff Sue Ministers Over "Deadly Working Conditions"
content: French healthcare workers and relatives of colleagues who killed themselves have filed a legal complaint against two ministers over "deadly working conditions" in public hospitals that they say are causing suicides, their lawyer said Monday.

title: Tribal man trampled to death by wild elephant in Kerala’s Thrissur
content: The body of the 20-year-old victim has been taken to the Government Hospital in Chalakkudi for a post-mortem

title: Southern Railway says loco pilot was not denied leave, records show otherwise
content: Contrary to the claims of the Southern Railway CPRO, official records reveal the leave application of the loco pilot was rejected despite the employee clearly mentioning that his wife had been admitted to hospital for delivery

title: Phone Mitra: A lifeline for homesick students
content: Through ‘Project Mitra’, students can access a structured psychological support service of headmasters and teaching staff who have been trained as ‘mental health warriors’

title: Working groups of taskforce set up by Supreme Court to identify causes of students’ suicides
content: National Task Force forms working groups to address student mental health concerns and prevent suicides in higher education.

title: Truckers’ strike against price rise begins; movement of goods across Karnataka likely to be hit
content: Barring milk delivery vehicles, all other goods carriers, including those transporting fuel, LPG, construction material, and essentials, will remain off the roads

title: Murdered girl suspected to be sexually abused, accused said to have been intoxicated
content: The victim’s family members carried out her funeral rites after the body was handed over to them following post-mortem in Hubballi

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu slams critics of ‘P4’ initiative, reiterates commitment to eliminating economic inequalities
content: Highlighting the transformative impact of the programme in empowering the poor, the Chief Minister lauds the entrepreneurs and industrialists who have stepped forward to support the cause

title: ASI seeks to shed new light on Dwarka through underwater expeditions, scientific analysis of recovered antiquities
content: The new study by the ASI has undertaken onshore and offshore expedition at Dwarka and Beyt Dwarka in Gujarat to search, document and study submerged archaeological remains in the place as well as ascertain the antiquity of the recovered objects through scientific analysis of sediments, archaeological and marine deposits

title: Clash between BJP, Congress party workers over plaque at Ambedkar statue’s pedestal in Rajasthan
content: Congress MLA among those involved in the scuffle over the plaque that was unveiled to the public in Bonli two years ago during Congress rule

title: Law Minister says Mamata Banerjee’s remark of not implementing Waqf law in Bengal is ‘not right’
content: Arjun Ram Meghwal noted Mamata Banerjee made a similar remark during the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, and said, “But CAA was implemented in West Bengal”

title: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu reinstates Ambedkar Overseas Education Scheme in Andhra Pradesh
content: Reiterating the government’s commitment to the uplift and educational empowerment of Dalits, the Chief Minister says around 7,000 students benefited from the scheme in 2014-19

title: West Bengal teachers rendered jobless take their protest to Delhi
content: Apart from a sit-in protest at Delhi’s Jantar Mantar on April 16, also planned is a march from Sealdah to Raj Bhavan, protests across different districts, a ‘relay hunger strike’, and an indefinite fast from May 8

title: Mining operations halted in A.P. due to coalition government, allege Tirupati MP
content: Though the mine owners have all the permits, the leaders of alliance parties are threatening them, claims Maddila Gurumoorthy

title: Caste census report: Veerashaiva Mahasabha plans its own survey; DKS to meet Vokkaliga MLAs today
content: Joint meeting of Mahasabha representatives with office bearers of Rajya Vokkaligara Sangha may take place before the Cabinet meet

title: Ambedkar is a global icon in the struggle for equality, says Khandre
content: He dedicated his life to eradicating social inequality, according to the Forest and Environment Minister

title: Modi ‘humbled’ by man who vowed not to use footwear till he met PM
content: Fourteen years ago, Rampal Kashyap had vowed not to use footwear till Narendra Modi became the Prime Minister and met him in person.

title: Centre frames draft rules for gas meters
content: The rules make it mandatory for all gas meters used for domestic, commercial, and industrial purposes to undergo testing, verification and stamping prior to their use in trade and commerce

title: Rich tributes paid to Dr. Ambedkar in Kurnool, Nandyal and Anantapur districts
content: Ministers, MPs and Collectors participate actively in the Ambedkar Jayanti celebrations held across the three districts, lionise the Father of the Indian Constitution as the champion of social justice and equal rights

title: SEIL Energy observes National Fire Service Day
content: The Nellore-based independent power producer is conducting various activities during National Fire Service Fortnight from April 14 to 28

title: CPI accuses BJP of undermining the spirit of Constitution
content: Party’s national secretary Mr. Narayana expresses regret over the fascist mentality of the Union government and calls upon public to oppose such ideologies that could break the country from within

title: MP calls for fast-tracking of Chittoor railway station modernisation, Tirupati-Katpadi doubling works
content: The Tirupati–Katpadi railway line doubling project would boost Chittoor district’s growth and integrated development, says Daggumalla

title: Hailstorm, heavy gales uproot trees in Chittoor
content: Uprooted trees fall on highway at Nelavai village in SR Puram mandal, causing traffic blockade for several hours

title: Two interstate burglars held for house break-in in Kerala's Kochi
content: The prime accused has a similar case registered against him at Aroor police station in Alappuzha district

title: Ambedkar proposed Sanskrit as national language, recalls NSU Vice-Chancellor
content: MP Daggumalla Prasada Rao, IMA national vice-president Daggumati Srihari Rao and ISRO scientist T. Srinivas Reddy pay floral tributes to Dr. Ambedkar

title: S&LP: BEE appreciates APSECM’s market surveillance measures
content: Standards and Labelling Programme helps the consumers in making informed decisions about energy-efficient appliances and equipment by providing star ratings

title: The paints cure as renowned tribal artist ‘Kitna’ passes away in the Nilgiris
content: R. Krishnan is credited by most members from the Alu Kurumba community of almost single-handedly popularising the community’s artistry through his canvas and cloth paintings for the best part of three decades

title: Safety lapses found in Nagpur factory blast, case booked
content: A report by the Directorate of Industrial Safety and Health found that the factory had failed to provide Personal Protective Equipment to its workers, thereby exposing them to high risk

title: YSR Congress Party challenges Wakf Act in Supreme Court
content: It alleges serious constitutional violations and failure to address the concerns of the  Muslim community

title: A.P. Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan’s wife offers prayers at Tirumala temple
content: Anna Lezhneva offers her hair, signs declaration form, takes part in Suprabhatam Seva, and donates ₹17 lakh towards one-day lunch expense at Nitya Annadanam Complex

title: Centre sanctions 160 new fire tenders for State, says A.P. Fire Services DG
content: In East Godavari district, two new fire stations are being constructed in Rajamahendravaram Rural and Devarapalli

title: Police seize 2 kg cocaine in Chennai, arrest 8 persons
content: The accused alleged that they found the contraband on the sea shore while collecting plastic waste. Investigation revealed that they were planning to sell the contraband in the city

title: Minister emphasizes on adherence to the Constitution, hails Babasaheb’s contribution
content: He gave the world’s biggest constitution to India when the country was in need of having its own constitution after Independence, says Darshanapur

title: Thousands gather at Deekshabhoomi, Chaityabhoomi to pay homage to Ambedkar on his birth anniversary
content: The Maharashtra government and Mumbai civic authorities had made special arrangements including medical camps, water facilities, and traffic management to handle the influx of visitors

title: Energy labels under watch: BEE cracks down on fake star ratings
content: BEE intensifies appliance label checks to protect consumers; praises Telangana Renewable Energy Development Corporation Ltd (TGREDCO) for energy rule enforcement

title: Man climbs stage carrying machete, arrested in Raichur district
content: The incident occurred when expelled BJP MLA Yatnal was addressing a gathering during Ram Navami celebrations in Lingsugur of Raichur

title: Government will support women in becoming industrialists: Bharath
content: Industries and Commerce Minister appreciates voluntary organisations which came forward to train women in preparing millet-based products at ‘pauSHEtik’, a women entrepreneurship development programme in millet-based baking, held in Kurnool

title: SBI chairman visits Yadagirigutta, hands over two EVs to temple
content: The vehicles are specifically intended to assist senior citizens, women and persons with disabilities, ensuring their convenience and comfort while navigating the temple premises

title: How India could be Trump's trump card in 'encircling' China
content: The US is crafting a strategy to counter China's global influence, with India playing a central role. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent envisions a coalition with India, Japan, Vietnam, and South Korea to isolate Beijing economically. India's openness to US trade deals and rejection of Chinese investments signal a strategic alignment, though it remains intertwined with Chinese supply chains.

title: 1st in India: Telangana effects quota within quota for SCs
content: Telangana has become the first state to implement sub-categorization of Scheduled Caste reservations, classifying 59 sub-castes into three groups. This move, coinciding with Dr. Ambedkar's 135th birth anniversary, allocates 1% reservation to Group I, 9% to Group II, and 5% to Group III.

title: Indian students eyeing US universities told to mind social media posts
content: Despite stricter US immigration policies, Indian students' interest in US higher education, especially STEM and AI programs, remains strong. A surge in applications to top universities indicates enduring appeal, driven by research opportunities and post-graduation prospects. Experts advise proactive planning and strategic visa applications amidst uncertainties, emphasizing adaptability and early job market preparation.

title: MS Dhoni and Shivam Dube end CSK's five-match losing streak
content: Chennai Super Kings snapped their five-match losing streak with a thrilling five-wicket victory over Lucknow Super Giants, fueled by MS Dhoni and Shivam Dube's explosive partnership. Chasing 167, CSK overcame a middle-order wobble, while LSG's Rishabh Pant's half-century went in vain. Dube credited Dhoni's aggressive batting for easing the pressure during the chase.

title: US: We will Revoke or Deny Visa if your FB or Instagram posts are ...
content: USCIS has officially declared that social media posts, particularly those deemed anti-Semitic or supporting designated terrorist groups like Hamas and Hezbollah, can lead to US visa rejection or revocation.

title: Bengali NY cancelled at Chittagong for 1st time in 47 years over vandalism
content: Bengali New Year celebrations in Chittagong were cancelled for the first time in 47 years after vandalism by unidentified individuals. The incident, which involved the destruction of banners and stages, led to protests and the suspension of scheduled programs.

title: Donald Trump again accuses Volodymyr Zelenskyy of starting war
content: Donald Trump has once again blamed Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky for the ongoing war with Russia, despite the devastating consequences of the conflict. Trump also implicated President Biden and Putin, asserting their shared responsibility for the war's outbreak and continuation.

title: 'Should minorities remain ... ': K'tka CM counters PM's attack on Muslim quota
content: Karnataka's chief minister Siddaramaiah defended the 4% quota for Muslims in public contracts, countering PM Modi's accusations of appeasement politics. Siddaramaiah asserted the move aims to uplift economically and socially disadvantaged minorities, while Deputy CM Shivakumar emphasized providing opportunities for all sections of society.

title: Katy Perry kisses Earth as Blue Origin Rocket returns from Space
content: Katy Perry and Lauren Sánchez were among the six women who journeyed to the edge of space aboard Blue Origin's New Shepard rocket, marking a historic all-female spaceflight. The suborbital flight provided a brief period of weightlessness, with Jeff Bezos greeting the crew upon their return. The event drew a crowd of high-profile figures, celebrating the mission as inspirational.

title: 'Marco Polo of turtles' swims from Odisha to Maharashtra for double nesting
content: An Olive Ridley turtle, tagged in Odisha in 2021, has made a remarkable 3,500km journey to Maharashtra's Konkan coast. This is the first recorded instance of such a long migration for the species. The turtle laid 120 eggs, challenging previous assumptions about distinct populations on India's east and west coasts, highlighting the interconnectedness of nesting sites.

title: Submit bank guarantees for 50% of Rs 5cr fine over violations: HC to Google
content: The Karnataka High Court has instructed Google India and its executives to provide bank guarantees covering 50% of the penalties levied for alleged FEMA violations. These penalties, totaling Rs 5.45 crore, stem from transactions involving distributor fees to Google Ireland and equipment purchases from Google US. The Enforcement Directorate claims these transactions, lacking RBI approval, constitute unauthorized commercial loans.

title: When Steve Jobs explained to Barack Obama why iPhones can’t be made in US
content: Donald Trump's push to revive US manufacturing through tariffs poses challenges for tech giants like Apple, heavily reliant on Chinese production. Despite some supply chain diversification, China remains Apple's primary manufacturing base.

title: Britain's Indian restaurant Veeraswamy under threat of closure. But why?
content: London's historic Michelin-starred Indian restaurant, Veeraswamy, faces potential closure after nearly a century. The Crown Estate, owner of the building, plans to reclaim the space to expand office reception areas, refusing to renew the restaurant's lease. Owner Ranjit Mathrani is contesting the decision in court, fearing job losses and business disruption if forced to relocate without a suitable alternative.

title: Dwyane Wade’s wife Gabrielle Union turns heads on red carpet
content: Following Dwyane Wade's surgery to remove cancer cells, his wife, Gabrielle Union, made a stunning appearance at the Fashion Trust U.S. Awards in a Celia Kritharioti Couture dress. Union also recently contributed to the 'Number One on the Call Sheet' documentary, discussing the challenges faced by African American actors in Hollywood and how Wade's health issues impacted their family.

title: AAP eyes Kashmir debut, to contest Budgam seat vacated by CM
content: Riding high on their Doda victory, AAP is now targeting the Kashmir Valley, declaring their intention to contest the Budgam assembly bypoll. This election was triggered by Omar Abdullah's decision to vacate the seat. While AAP J&K chief Mehraj Malik aims to win, National Conference is yet to announce their candidate, with calls for a local representative.

title: How Mehul Choksi plans to resist extradition to India from Belgium
content: Fugitive diamond merchant Mehul Choksi, wanted in India for allegedly defrauding Punjab National Bank (PNB) of nearly Rs 14,000 crore, has been arrested in Belgium. His legal team is contesting extradition, citing the case's political nature and Choksi's poor health, including cancer treatment and PTSD from a prior alleged kidnapping.

title: 'Intervene & restore normalcy': Bengal BJP writes to guv amid violence
content: Amidst escalating violence in West Bengal following anti-Waqf law protests, BJP chief Sukanta Majumdar has appealed to Governor CV Ananda Bose for intervention. Majumdar expressed grave concerns over the situation in Murshidabad, citing displacement of families and urged for peace restoration and a judicial inquiry. Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has called for peace and unity, emphasizing religious harmony.

title: Who is Shaik Rasheed, the youngest player to open for CSK in IPL history?
content: Shaik Rasheed, at 20 years and 202 days, became CSK's youngest-ever opener, surpassing Sam Curran's record. The Andhra native debuted against LSG, scoring a quickfire 27 off 19 balls, including six boundaries. His impressive start provided a solid foundation for CSK, marking only the third instance this season where they crossed 50 in the powerplay.

title: Respect people’s mandate, allow Omar govt to function: Tarigami to Centre
content: CPM MLA M Y Tarigami criticized the BJP and central government for allegedly hindering the Omar Abdullah government's functioning and demanded the restoration of statehood to Jammu and Kashmir. He highlighted the executive orders, domicile laws, and media restrictions imposed after the abrogation of Article 370. Tarigami also condemned the Waqf (Amendment) Act, fearing increased communal polarization.

title: 5.1 magnitude earthquake hits San Diego
content: A magnitude 5.1 earthquake struck southern California near Julian, a town close to the US-Mexico border, originating at a depth of eight miles. The quake, followed by aftershocks, caused no immediate reports of injuries or damage. Southern California is seismically active due to its location on tectonic plate boundaries, having experienced major quakes like the 1994 Northridge event.

title: $22bn pivot: How Apple's India bet is paying off amid US-China trade war
content: Apple's iPhone production in India has surged by 60% to $22 billion, now accounting for one in five iPhones globally. This shift, driven by geopolitical tensions and supply chain vulnerabilities, positions India as a key export hub. Foxconn is expanding its manufacturing footprint in Uttar Pradesh, signaling a long-term commitment to India's growing industrial ecosystem.

title: Instant Scholar: Marie Curie’s Phd thesis that revolutionised radioactivity research
content: 'Instant Scholar' is a Times of India initiative to make academic research accessible to a wider audience. If you are a Ph.D. scholar and would like to publish a summary of your research in this section, please share a summary and authorisation to publish it. For submission, and any question on this initiative, write to us at instantscholar@timesgroup.com

title: In a first, Nvidia to build AI supercomputer chips entirely in US
content: Nvidia will manufacture advanced AI chips in America. This is a first for the tech company. Production will be at TSMC facilities in Arizona. New supercomputer plants are coming up in Texas. Foxconn and Wistron are strategic partners. Full production will ramp up in 12 to 15 months. The move aims to meet growing AI chip demand.

title: Magnus Carlsen clinches Freestyle Chess Grand Slam title in Paris
content: Magnus Carlsen triumphed at the Freestyle Chess Grand Slam in Paris, securing the title by defeating Hikaru Nakamura 1.5–0.5 in the final. Carlsen's dominant performance earned him the $200,000 first prize, solidifying his status in this innovative format. Fabiano Caruana claimed third place, edging out Vincent Keymer and securing a spot in the upcoming Grand Slam event in the USA.

title: Dhoni creates history, becomes first player to achieve this big feat in IPL
content: MS Dhoni achieved a significant milestone in IPL history, becoming the first player to record 200 dismissals. The CSK captain reached this feat during a match against LSG, stumping Ayush Badoni. Dhoni's quick reflexes and awareness behind the stumps were on full display as he continues to solidify his legacy as IPL's greatest wicketkeeper.

title: 'Migrating within Bengal': TMC minister's odd remark amid anti-Waqf riots
content: Amidst protests against new Waqf laws and claims of communal violence in Murshidabad, West Bengal minister Firhad Hakim downplayed the situation, stating that people are relocating within the state, not fleeing. BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari alleges that over 400 Hindus were forced to leave their homes due to the violence, blaming Trinamool Congress' appeasement policies.

title: 'Shariat first, then Constitution': JMM minister sparks row, BJP hits back
content: The BJP strongly criticized Jharkhand minister Hafizul Hassan for his "a Muslim keeps the Quran in his heart and the Constitution in his hand" remarks, deeming them an insult to Indian democracy. Speaking on the ongoing Waqf protests Hassan had said that Muslims hold the Quran in their hearts and the Constitution in their hands. The BJP accused the INDIA bloc of harboring individuals who prioritize religious law. Hassan had alleged the Centre is targeting Muslims and warns of potential unrest.

title: 'Sab theek hai': Bumrah, Karun hug it out after heated exchange. Watch
content: A heated on-field clash between Jasprit Bumrah and Karun Nair during Sunday's IPL match between Delhi Capitals and Mumbai Indians sparked debate. The incident, stemming from a collision while Nair was batting, saw a visibly upset Bumrah. However, Delhi Capitals released a video showing Bumrah and Nair embracing post-match, confirming that the tension had dissipated.

title: 'Don't play games with religion': CM Mamata on anti-Waqf protests
content: West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee addressed the ongoing violence in the state, emphasizing the right to protest while urging citizens to maintain peace and avoid taking the law into their own hands. Her statement follows clashes between Indian Secular Front supporters and police in Bhangar, resulting in injuries and the torching of police vehicles after restrictions were imposed on an anti-Waqf Act rally.

title: Top 5 news: Tahawwur's NIA grilling, Mehul Choksi’s extradition & more
content: India is actively pursuing legal actions against individuals involved in major crimes and security threats. Tahawwur Rana, a suspect in the 26/11 Mumbai attacks, is being interrogated by the NIA, while efforts are underway to extradite Mehul Choksi from Belgium in connection with the PNB fraud.

title: Fresh violence hits Bengal: Vehicles torched, many hurt in anti-Waqf stir
content: Clashes broke out in West Bengal's South 24 Parganas between ISF supporters and police during protests against the Waqf (Amendment) Act. The violence escalated when police prevented protestors from marching to a rally, resulting in torched vehicles, injuries, and arrests. This follows similar unrest in Murshidabad, prompting calls for central intervention and deployment of central forces.

title: Bengali New Year: 75+ Pohela Boishakh greetings, wishes & quotes
content: Pohela Boishakh, the Bengali New Year, is a vibrant festival celebrated with enthusiasm by Bengali communities worldwide. It marks new beginnings with traditional feasts, colorful attire, and cultural performances. People exchange warm wishes, reconnect with their roots, and enjoy delicacies like panta bhaat and ilish maach, seeking blessings for a brighter future.

title: Katy Perry, Bezos' fiancée back on Earth after reaching space
content: Katy Perry, Gayle King, and Lauren Sánchez soared into space aboard a Blue Origin rocket from West Texas, marking the company's 11th human flight. The all-female crew, including Aisha Bowe, Amanda Nguyn, and Kerianne Flynn, saw Perry express her mission as boundary-breaking, inspiring young girls to dream big.

title: 'Biden's war, not mine': Trump after Zelenskyy's Ukraine invite
content: After Ukraine president Volodymyr Zelenskyy appealed to President Trump to visit Ukraine following a fresh Russian attack on Sumy that Russia denied, Trump repeated that he has nothing to do with the Russia-Ukraine war. "President Zelenskyy and Crooked Joe Biden did an absolutely horrible job in allowing this travesty to begin. There were so many ways of preventing it from ever starting. But that is the past," he posted on Truth Social.

title: Rahul Tripathi's stunning catch lights up his 100th IPL game - Watch
content: In his 100th IPL match, Rahul Tripathi's spectacular catch stole the show during the CSK versus LSG game at Ekana Stadium. Tripathi's athletic dive at mid-off dismissed Aiden Markram off Khaleel Ahmed's delivery, giving CSK a brilliant start after they chose to bowl. CSK made two changes, including Shaik Rasheed and Jamie Overton, while LSG brought back Mitchell Marsh.

title: Pettersson set to push Vancouver Canucks to pivotal game against Sharks
content: The Vancouver Canucks, led by Elias Pettersson and Quinn Hughes, are set to face the San Jose Sharks in their second-to-last regular season game. With two games remaining, they are well-positioned to finish strong. The Canucks have a deep, well-rounded lineup, with top lines led by Jake DeBrusk, Pius Suter, and Brock Boeser. They also have depth in young centres and a strong defense

title: Watch: KL Rahul's heartwarming fan moment steals the spotlight
content: Despite a batting failure in Delhi Capitals' loss to Mumbai Indians, KL Rahul's heartwarming post-match gesture towards fans in wheelchairs went viral. He posed for photos, signed autographs, and interacted with supporters, showcasing his kindness. This act of compassion became the highlight, overshadowing the team's defeat and highlighting the human aspect of sports.

title: Watch: PM Modi helps barefoot admirer fulfil 14-year vow
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met Rampal Kashyap, an admirer who vowed to remain barefoot until Modi became Prime Minister and they met. At a Haryana rally, Modi fulfilled Kashyap's 14-year vow by personally putting shoes on him. While acknowledging the affection, Modi urged supporters to channel their devotion into social work and nation-building projects during his visit to Haryana.

title: IPL: Why R Ashwin was dropped against Lucknow Super Giants
content: Chennai Super Kings made changes for their match against Lucknow Super Giants. Ravichandran Ashwin was dropped from the team. Jamie Overton and Shaik Rasheed replaced Ashwin and Devon Conway. MS Dhoni wanted to bowl first due to dew. Lucknow Super Giants included Mitchell Marsh. Rishabh Pant also wanted to bowl first. CSK aimed to improve their performance after recent losses.

title: Big blow for Punjab Kings! Star pacer likely to miss remainder of IPL 2025
content: Punjab Kings face a setback as Lockie Ferguson is likely out for the remainder of IPL 2025 due to a serious left thigh injury sustained against Sunrisers Hyderabad. Fast bowling coach James Hopes confirmed Ferguson's indefinite absence, creating a void in Punjab's pace attack. The team will now consider replacements like Xavier Bartlett, Azmatullah Omarzai, Vijaykumar Vyshak, and Yash Thakur.

title: NIA grilling Rana for 8-10 hours daily to uncover 'larger conspiracy'
content: Tahawwur Rana, the alleged mastermind of the 26/11 Mumbai attacks, is currently being interrogated by the NIA for up to ten hours daily. Extradited from the US, Rana is held in a high-security cell in Delhi. The NIA aims to uncover the broader conspiracy behind the attacks that killed 166. Rana is cooperating, and has requested a pen, some paper or a notepad, and a copy of the Quran.

title: Anti-Waqf protests: Plea in SC seeks SIT probe into Murshidabad violence
content: A plea has been filed in the Supreme Court seeking a court-monitored SIT investigation into the Murshidabad violence during anti-Waqf law protests. The petition also seeks protection for vulnerable lives and properties. Following the violence, the Calcutta High Court ordered CAPF deployment. Authorities are working to restore peace, with some families returning home.

title: India has requested fugitive Choksi's extradition, confirms Belgium
content: Fugitive Mehul Choksi, wanted in connection with the Rs 13,000 crore PNB bank loan fraud, has been arrested in Belgium following an extradition request from India. Indian authorities are actively pursuing his extradition, presenting arrest warrants to Belgian officials. Choksi's lawyer is contesting the extradition, citing concerns about human rights and prison conditions in India, claiming the case is politically motivated.

title: Hornets star Ball must 'get stronger,' coach says
content: laMelo ball is a 6-foot-7, 190-pound cornerstone point guard . his defense improved as the season progressed . coach Charles Lee left no doubt about his offseason expectations . "he's got to get stronger," he said following exit interviews .

title: Postseason bracket first look: X factors, best-case scenarios, big questions
content: the Eastern Conference bracket was finalized on friday . there are now officially 20 teams fighting for a chance to win the Larry O'Brien trophy . no team has repeated since the Warriors in 2017 and 2018, making this one of the longest droughts without a repeat champion .

title: Week 9: Top 25 rankings and what to watch
content: the Texas Longhorns have taken over the top spot this week in college baseball . they took two games on the road against Kentucky in their latest series . if they can show up strong in that series, there's no reason why they would slide down .

title: Volkanovski is back, Pimblett shines -- again
content: Alexander Volkanovski defeated Diego Lopes by unanimous decision to win the featherweight championship . yair Rodriguez revived his career with an impressive performance to ruin Patricio Pitbull's debut . "Old Man Volk" is champion once again but the division is a lot different than the one he reigned over .

title: Betting the 2025 NBA playoffs: Futures bets to make, best long shots
content: the 2024-25 NBA playoffs begin Tuesday with the play-in tournament . the first round starts on Saturday, with the winners of each best-of-seven series advancing to the conference semifinals . what teams stand out as potentially undervalued and overlooked? here are the bets and teams they have their eyes on .

title: Fantasy baseball buzz: Justin Steele and all you need to know for Monday
content: our fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the episode of forearm soreness that Steele experienced in late 2024 was an indicator of things to come, as his 2025 season has come to an abrupt conclusion .

title: How the standings can shift with Monday's six games
content: the six games taking place on tuesday are scheduled for the end of the regular season . 14 of 16 clubs have punched their tickets, though a variety of seeds remain in contention . a win by the Columbus Blue Jackets on Sunday kept them in the playoff race for at least one more day .

title: NWSL Power Rankings: Banda's Pride No. 1, winless Utah sink
content: barbra Banda beats barbra 1-0 at home to make it 1-0 . barbra are still the team to beat after defeating reign 1-0 on saturday . kate moss' side are outshot 13 to 7 and 5 to 4 on target .

content: tremor was centered 2.5 miles (four kilometers) south of Julian, which sits 20 miles from the US border with Mexico . initial quake followed by a series of smaller aftershocks . there were no immediate reports of damage .
